alert.note: Alert for Alger; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 10:56PM EDT until April 01 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and mixed precipitation, changing to all snow. There will be a sharp range of snow accumulations from northwest to southeast across the area, ranging from around 1 inch at Big Bay increasing to 10 to 14 inches from Arnold to Trenary, Shingleton and Seney. A light glaze of ice accumulation is possible. Northeast winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Marquette and Alger Counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds, in combination with wet, heavy snow, may lead to downed tree limbs and power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
